meanings.definition: Temporary framework used to support a structure during construction.
meanings.sent1: The falsework helped hold up the new bridge while it was being built.
meanings.sent2: The construction workers set up the falsework before starting to build the skyscraper.
meanings.sent3: The falsework decided to take a break and collapsed in a comical way.
meanings.sent4: The falsework stood tall like a giant skeleton supporting the massive building.
meanings.sent5: The falsework creaked and groaned under the weight of the heavy beams.

meanings.definition: The act of constructing temporary support structures.
meanings.sent1: The falsework required careful planning and precise measurements.
meanings.sent2: The falsework of the bridge was completed before the actual construction began.
meanings.sent3: The falsework threw a party to celebrate its successful completion of the project.
meanings.sent4: The falsework of ideas supported the development of the new invention.
meanings.sent5: The falsework of teamwork was essential in setting up the event.
